text: Sedecula is a genus of fungi in the order Agaricales. It is incertae sedis with respect to familial placement within the order. The genus is monotypic, containing the single species Sedecula pulvinata, found in the United States, and first described by American mycologist Sanford Myron Zeller in 1941. ==References== Category:Agaricales incertae sedis Category:Fungi described in 1941 Category:Fungi of North America Category:Monotypic Agaricales genera
title: Sedecula
